Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add complete deployment infrastructure and testing framework

Complete production-ready infrastructure for multi-platform deployment:

Platform Configuration Files (3 files):

1. netlify.toml (200+ lines)
   - Complete Netlify configuration
   - Service Worker headers (no-cache for sw.js)
   - Asset caching (1 year for JS/CSS/images)
   - Security headers (CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options)
   - Permissions-Policy for WebXR (xr-spatial-tracking)
   - Gzip/Brotli compression
   - Lighthouse plugin (performance thresholds)
   - Link checker plugin
   - Environment variables
   - Development server config

2. vercel.json (150+ lines)
   - Vercel deployment configuration
   - Static builds for HTML/assets
   - Service Worker routing
   - Complete header configuration
   - Cache control for all assets
   - Security headers
   - Permissions-Policy for WebXR
   - Rewrites for SPA routing
   - GitHub integration settings

3. package.json (updated)
   - Added test scripts (jest, coverage, watch)
   - Added Docker scripts (build, run, compose)
   - Added devDependencies (Jest, Babel)
   - Test: npm test
   - Docker: npm run docker:build/run/compose

Docker Infrastructure (5 files):

4. Dockerfile (80+ lines)
   - Multi-stage build (builder + production)
   - Node 20 alpine for builder stage
   - Nginx alpine for production
   - Optimized layer caching
   - Build info generation
   - File cleanup for production
   - Health check integration
   - Brotli compression support
   - Timezone configuration (Asia/Tokyo)
   - Proper permissions (nginx user)

5. docker/nginx.conf (200+ lines)
   - Production-grade Nginx configuration
   - Gzip + Brotli compression
   - Service Worker headers (no-cache, Service-Worker-Allowed)
   - Long-term caching for static assets (1 year)
   - Security headers (CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options)
   - WebXR Permissions-Policy
   - Health check endpoint (/health)
   - Nginx status endpoint (monitoring)
   - Error pages (404, 50x)
   - Attack pattern blocking
   - HTTPS configuration template (commented)

6. docker/healthcheck.sh
   - Container health monitoring
   - Nginx process check
   - HTTP response verification
   - File existence validation

7. docker-compose.yml (120+ lines)
   - Multi-service orchestration
   - VR browser service with health checks
   - Nginx cache service
   - Resource limits (CPU/Memory)
   - Volume management (logs, cache)
   - Network configuration (bridge)
   - Logging configuration
   - Optional Prometheus monitoring
   - Environment variables

8. .dockerignore
   - Optimized build context
   - Excludes: node_modules, .git, tests, logs
   - Reduces image size significantly

Testing Framework (2 files):

9. tests/vr-modules.test.js (350+ lines)
   - Comprehensive test suite
   - Module existence tests (21+ modules)
   - VRTextRenderer tests (font calculations)
   - VRErgonomicUI tests (viewing zones, button sizes)
   - VRComfortSystem tests (FPS targets, frame times)
   - VRPerformanceProfiler tests (bottleneck detection)
   - VRInputOptimizer tests (input modes, dwell time)
   - VRContentOptimizer tests (resolution limits)
   - Documentation verification
   - Example files verification
   - Configuration files verification
   - CI/CD workflow verification

10. jest.config.js
    - Jest configuration
    - Test environment: node
    - Coverage collection from VR modules
    - Coverage thresholds (50% global)
    - Module name mapping
    - Transform configuration (Babel)
    - Timeout: 10s

Community Guidelines (2 files):

11. CONTRIBUTING.md (600+ lines)
    - Complete contribution guide in Japanese
    - Development setup instructions
    - Code contribution guidelines
    - Bug report template
    - Feature request template
    - Pull request process
    - Coding conventions (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)
    - Commit message format (Conventional Commits)
    - Testing requirements
    - Documentation standards
    - Code review criteria
    - Release process
    - Community communication channels

12. CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md (200+ lines)
    - Contributor Covenant 2.1
    - Japanese translation
    - Community standards
    - Enforcement guidelines (4 levels)
    - Contact information
    - Effective date: 2025-10-19

Key Features:

Deployment:
âœ… GitHub Pages (auto-deploy via Actions)
âœ… Netlify (one-click deploy)
âœ… Vercel (one-click deploy)
âœ… Docker (multi-platform container)
âœ… Custom servers (Nginx config)

âœ… 21+ module existence tests
âœ… Functional tests (calculations, logic)
âœ… Documentation verification

Community:

Commands Added:

npm run test:coverage    # Coverage report
npm run docker:build     # Build Docker image
npm run docker:run       # Run container
npm run docker:compose   # Docker Compose up

Add development infrastructure: documentation, tools, and benchmarking

Complete development infrastructure for professional VR browser project:

   - Control reference (controller, hand tracking, voice, keyboard)
   - Common issues and troubleshooting
   - Next steps and support information

2. docs/TESTING.md (800+ lines)
   - Comprehensive testing guide
   - Testing strategy and test pyramid
   - Unit test examples (VRTextRenderer, VRErgonomicUI, VRComfortSystem)
   - Integration test examples (WebXR API, Three.js)
   - E2E testing with Playwright
   - VR device testing checklist
   - Performance testing (FPS, memory)
   - Accessibility testing (WCAG compliance)
   - CI/CD integration
   - Coverage goals and improvement tips
   - Best practices (AAA pattern, mocking)
   - Troubleshooting guide

Performance Benchmarking Tools (2 files, ~700 lines):

3. tools/benchmark.js (600+ lines)
   - Comprehensive performance benchmark tool
   - Module load time measurement
   - Memory usage analysis
   - Statistical metrics (min, max, mean, median, stdDev, P95, P99)
   - Multiple output formats (JSON, CSV, Markdown)
   - Performance grading (A+ to D)
   - Command-line interface with options
   - Warmup iterations for accurate results
   - Batch benchmarking for all modules
   - Detailed summary and reporting

4. tools/README.md (100+ lines)

   - Usage examples for benchmark tool

   - CI/CD integration examples
   - Troubleshooting guide

Visual Assets Infrastructure:

   - Logo, screenshots, icons, banners organization
   - Design guidelines (colors, typography)
   - File naming conventions
   - Image optimization recommendations
   - Complete asset documentation

Updated Files:

6. package.json
   - Added benchmark scripts:
     * npm run benchmark - Run benchmark tool
     * npm run benchmark:all - Benchmark all modules
     * npm run benchmark:module - Benchmark specific module
     * npm run benchmark:report - Generate Markdown report
   - Added testing scripts:
     * npm run test:integration - Integration tests
     * npm run test:e2e - E2E tests with Playwright
     * npm run ci:test - CI test suite

Features:

Quick Start Guide:

âœ… VR device testing procedures

Benchmark Tool:
âœ… Load time measurement
âœ… Memory usage analysis
âœ… Statistical analysis (P95, P99, stdDev)
âœ… Performance grading (A+ to D)
âœ… Multiple output formats
âœ… Batch processing
âœ… CI/CD integration ready

Performance Metrics Tracked:
- File size (KB)
- Load time (min, max, mean, median, P95, P99)
- Memory usage (bytes, KB, MB)
- Performance grade (A+ to D)

Benchmark Output Formats:
âœ… JSON (machine-readable)
âœ… CSV (spreadsheet-compatible)
âœ… Markdown (documentation-friendly)

Usage Examples:

Quick Start:
```bash
# Clone and setup
git clone <repo-url>
cd qui-browser-vr
npm install

# Start development server
npx http-server -p 8080

# Test on VR device
# Access http://<your-ip>:8080 on Meta Quest Browser
```

Testing:
```bash
# Run all tests
npm test

# Run with coverage
npm run test:coverage

# Run integration tests
npm run test:integration

# Run E2E tests
npm run test:e2e
```

Benchmarking:
```bash
# Benchmark single module
npm run benchmark -- --module vr-text-renderer --iterations 1000

# Benchmark all modules
npm run benchmark:all

# Generate report
npm run benchmark:report
```

Performance Grading Scale:
- A+ (< 1ms) - Excellent
- A (1-5ms) - Very Good
- B (5-10ms) - Good
- C (10-20ms) - Fair
- D (> 20ms) - Needs Optimization

Infrastructure Benefits:

âœ… Performance monitoring tools
âœ… CI/CD ready
âœ… Multi-language support
âœ… Visual asset organization
